quotes: Brown graduated from Edinburgh with an undergraduate MA degree with First-Class Honours in history in 1972.
He stayed on to obtain his PhD degree in history, which he gained ten years later in 1982, defending a thesis titled The Labour Party and Political Change in Scotland 1918â€“1929.
In 1972, while still a student, Brown was elected Rector of the University of Edinburgh, the convener of the University Court.
He served as Rector until 1975, and also edited the document The Red Paper on Scotland.
From 1976 to 1980 Brown was employed as a lecturer in politics at Glasgow College of Technology.
In the 1979 general election, Brown stood for the Edinburgh South constituency, losing to the Conservative candidate, Michael Ancram.

organizations.name: Edinburgh Royal Infirmary
quotes: Brown underwent experimental surgery at the Edinburgh Royal Infirmary and his right eye was saved by a young eye surgeon, Hector Chawla.

quotes: He also worked as a tutor for the Open University.
